metadata.feature_description: Tests the Save button element in the UI (currently non-functional placeholder)

steps.expected: Successfully logged in and PersonaBar visible
steps.actual: Login successful, PersonaBar visible with menu items including Accounts (user avatar icon)

steps.action: Locate and click on Accounts menu item in PersonaBar (user avatar icon labeled 'nav_Accounts')
steps.expected: Account Settings panel opens showing the Save button
steps.actual: Accounts menu item (Evoq.Accounts) exists in PersonaBar but clicking it does not open any panel. The AccountSettings.html content containing the Save button is not loaded.

issues: The Accounts menu item exists in the PersonaBar but does not open the AccountSettings panel when clicked
The Save button defined in AccountSettings.html is inaccessible because the panel does not load

observations: Code review shows AccountSettings.html contains a Save button with 'primarybtn' CSS class: Save
The Save button in code has no href or onclick handler - it is a non-functional placeholder as described in the feature description
The Evoq.Accounts menu item is registered in the PersonaBar (verified via DOM inspection: id='Evoq.Accounts', class='btn_panel useravatar')
The AccountSettings.js contains only stub init() and load() functions with no event bindings for the Save button
No AccountSettings panel is created when clicking the Accounts menu - only an Assets panel exists in the DOM
This appears to be a placeholder/skeleton module that has not been fully implemented in the UI layer
